intro: Taraxacum megricum, commonly known as the Sicilian dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, spoon-shaped leaves and a distinctive hollow stem. The plant produces a yellow flower head that develops into a spherical seed head with parachute-like seeds. It is native to southern Europe, particularly Sicily, and thrives in dry, rocky soils. Taraxacum megricum is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields.
